title: Venezuela’s Heavy Oil Gets a Lifeline from US Naphtha
summary: US naphtha has begun arriving in Venezuelan waters, marking an early and telling step in efforts to restart the country’s long-crippled heavy oil production. Ship tracking data showed a tanker chartered by Vitol reaching Venezuelan waters with the first naphtha cargo tied to a new oil deal between …

title: U.S. Oil Drillers Add One Rig as Winter Weather Sets In
summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States rose by 1 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US to 544 this week, down 32 from this same time last year. The number of active oil rigs rose by 1 for…

title: Gold heads for best week since 2008 as Greenland crisis rattles dollar

title: Gold is at an all-time high—here's the best way to own it, according to financial experts
summary: The optimal way to own gold depends largely upon your reason for buying, investing pros say.

title: There's a new idea of alpha in the market that big money managers are pursuing
summary: Stock pickers can't beat the S&P 500, and market experts say it's time to stop trying and seek broader portfolio alpha across cash, bonds, gold and commodities.

title: Indian Refiner BPCL to Sign $780 Million Oil Supply Deal With Petrobras
summary: India’s state-owned refiner Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) is set to sign next week an oil supply deal with Brazilian state giant Petrobras for the delivery of 12 million barrels of crude, valued at about $780 million. title: Adani group stocks plunge as U.S. SEC looks to question founder over fraud charges
summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is seeking permission to send summons to Gautam Adani and two others over fraud and bribery charges.
